intro: Myosotis versicolor var. dubia, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its delicate, blue or purple flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, often found in rocky or alpine environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and wildflower displays.
